Subject: Recording performance of classes, is it possible in JUnit ?
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
From: Sunento Wu <sunentowu@...>

Hello,

I just downloaded JUnit yesterday. And briefly read
through the API Documentation.

Currently I am doing investigation for the performance
of our Java Classes.

What I am about thinking to do will be : just insert a
Timer class to record the time before executing the
statements and after executed, and then , print the
result ( after execution time - before execution
time).

I wonder whether in JUnit has the feature to record
the performance of my classes ?

Does some body have idea about this ?

Thank millions,

sunento
